Test: cor2cov

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2020-07-08

Source: vignettes/tests/test_cor2cov.Rmd
test_cor2cov.Rmd
library(testthat)
library(MASS)
library(jeksterslabRmatrix)
context("Test cor2cov.")

Parameters

slopes <- runif(
  n = 3,
  min = .10,
  max = .50
)
tau_prime <- slopes[1]
beta <- slopes[2]
alpha <- slopes[3]
sigma2 <- runif(
  n = 3,
  min = 10^2,
  max = 15^2
)
sigma2X <- sigma2[1]
sigma2M <- sigma2[2]
sigma2Y <- sigma2[3]
mu <- runif(
  n = 3,
  min = 5^2,
  max = 10^2
)
muX <- mu[1]
muM <- mu[2]
muY <- mu[3]
sigma2epsilonM <- sigma2M - alpha^2 * sigma2X
sigma2epsilonY <- sigma2Y - (beta^2 * alpha^2 * sigma2X) - (beta^2 * sigma2epsilonM) - (2 * alpha * beta * tau_prime * sigma2X) - (tau_prime^2 * sigma2X)
delta_M <- muM - alpha * muX
delta_Y <- muY - tau_prime * muX - beta * muM
A <- matrix(
  data = c(
    0,
    alpha,
    tau_prime,
    0,
    0,
    beta,
    0,
    0,
    0
  ),
  ncol = 3
)
S <- matrix(
  data = c(
    sigma2X,
    0,
    0,
    0,
    sigma2epsilonM,
    0,
    0,
    0,
    sigma2epsilonY
  ),
  ncol = 3
)
F <- diag(3)
I <- diag(3)
x <- solve(I - A)
Sigma <- F %*% x %*% S %*% t(x) %*% t(F)
R <- cov2cor(Sigma)
knitr::kable(
  x = Sigma,
  row.names = FALSE,
  caption = "Covariance Matrix ($\\boldsymbol{\\Sigma}$)"
)
#> Warning in kable_pipe(x = structure(c("138.49761", "47.53754", "79.70736", : The
#> table should have a header (column names)
Covariance Matrix (\(\boldsymbol{\Sigma}\))
138.49761 47.53754 79.70736
47.53754 121.83636 64.79059
79.70736 64.79059 137.34834 
knitr::kable(
  x = R,
  row.names = FALSE,
  caption = "Correlation Matrix ($\\dot{\\boldsymbol{\\Sigma}}$)"
)
#> Warning in kable_pipe(x = structure(c("1.0000000", "0.3659545", "0.5779171", :
#> The table should have a header (column names)
Correlation Matrix (\(\dot{\boldsymbol{\Sigma}}\))
1.0000000 0.3659545 0.5779171
0.3659545 1.0000000 0.5008547
0.5779171 0.5008547 1.0000000

Generate Data with \(\hat{\boldsymbol{\Sigma}}\) equal to \(\boldsymbol{\Sigma}\) 

data <- mvrnorm(
  n = 1000,
  mu = c(100, 100, 100),
  Sigma = Sigma,
  empirical = TRUE
)

Results

results_Sigma <- cor2cov(
  cor = cor(data),
  sd = c(15, 15, 15)
)
results_R <- cov2cor(
  results_Sigma
)
knitr::kable(
  x = results_Sigma,
  row.names = FALSE,
  caption = "Covariance Matrix"
)
#> Warning in kable_pipe(x = structure(c("225.00000", "82.33977", "130.03135", :
#> The table should have a header (column names)
Covariance Matrix
225.00000 82.33977 130.0314
82.33977 225.00000 112.6923
130.03135 112.69231 225.0000 
knitr::kable(
  x = results_R,
  row.names = FALSE,
  caption = "Correlation Matrix"
)
#> Warning in kable_pipe(x = structure(c("1.0000000", "0.3659545", "0.5779171", :
#> The table should have a header (column names)
Correlation Matrix
1.0000000 0.3659545 0.5779171
0.3659545 1.0000000 0.5008547
0.5779171 0.5008547 1.0000000

testthat

test_that("Covariance", {
  expect_equivalent(
    results_Sigma,
    Sigma,
    cov(data)
  )
})
test_that("Correlation", {
  expect_equivalent(
    results_R,
    R,
    cor(data)
  )
})
